channel.title: Editing .mpr_file_store_32?
channel.description: Im wondering if theres a way to edit the .dat files in the .mpr_file_store_32. I already asked some people, but i never got any response. I know that i can open them with a hex editor, but im wondering if theres a way to edit them or view them with a certain program.

item.title: Editing .mpr_file_store_32?
item.dc:creator: @S.A.H.U_Haxor S.A.H.U. Haxor
item.description:
@S.A.H.U_Haxor wrote:

hmm… Ill try that. I tried another unpacker, but it said it was using runtime to end the program in an unusual way. I tried googling it, and got nothing but information about unpacking files, but not how to do it. Anybody else possibly know?

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .mpr_file_store_32?
item.dc:creator: @459_expert 459 expert
item.description:
@459_expert wrote:

It might work, but i am not using windows.I am using linux. so i have to google it. and i am going to attempt to unpack the cache for the 377, and hopefully edit some weapons.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .mpr_file_store_32?
item.dc:creator: @agent0002 agent0002
item.description:
@agent0002 wrote:

have you ever tried selecting “use a web service to find the appropriate program” option when you try to open the .dat files? that might give you a list. or it might not, i don’t know how dependable it is.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @S.A.H.U_Haxor S.A.H.U. Haxor
item.description:
@S.A.H.U_Haxor wrote:

well i found 2 .dat unpackers, one’s in russian, and the other one says

Unpacking “” [0 Bytes]…ok

over and over again. Anybody else happen to know?

Read full topic
